verses.kjv: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith the LORD God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.web: Then LORD said to Moses, “Go in to Pharaoh, and tell him, ‘This is what LORD, the God of the Hebrews, says: “Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Go to Pharaoh and tell him, 'This is what the LORD, the God of the Hebrews, says: Let my people go so they can worship me.

verses.kjv: For if thou refuse to let them go, and wilt hold them still,
verses.web: For if you refuse to let them go, and hold them still,
verses.ct: If you refuse to let them go and keep holding them,

verses.kjv: Behold, the hand of the LORD is upon thy cattle which is in the field, upon the horses, upon the asses, upon the camels, upon the oxen, and upon the sheep: there shall be a very grievous murrain.
verses.web: behold, LORD’s hand is on your livestock which are in the field, on the horses, on the donkeys, on the camels, on the herds, and on the flocks with a very grievous pestilence.
verses.ct: the LORD's hand will strike your livestock out in the fields — your horses, donkeys, camels, cattle, and sheep — with a terrible plague.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall sever between the cattle of Israel and the cattle of Egypt: and there shall nothing die of all that is the children’s of Israel.
verses.web: LORD will make a distinction between the livestock of Israel and the livestock of Egypt; and nothing shall die of all that belongs to the children of Israel.” ’ ”
verses.ct: But the LORD will make a distinction between Israel's livestock and Egypt's livestock. Not a single animal belonging to the Israelites will die.'"

verses.kjv: And the LORD appointed a set time, saying, To morrow the LORD shall do this thing in the land.
verses.web: LORD appointed a set time, saying, “Tomorrow LORD shall do this thing in the land.”
verses.ct: The LORD set a specific time, saying, "Tomorrow the LORD will do this throughout the land."

verses.kjv: And the LORD did that thing on the morrow, and all the cattle of Egypt died: but of the cattle of the children of Israel died not one.
verses.web: LORD did that thing on the next day; and all the livestock of Egypt died, but of the livestock of the children of Israel, not one died.
verses.ct: The next day, the LORD did exactly that. All the livestock of Egypt died, but not one animal belonging to the Israelites was lost.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh sent, and, behold, there was not one of the cattle of the Israelites dead. And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he did not let the people go.
verses.web: Pharaoh sent, and, behold, there was not so much as one of the livestock of the Israelites dead. But the heart of Pharaoh was stubborn, and he didn’t let the people go.
verses.ct: Pharaoh sent people to investigate, and sure enough, not a single Israelite animal had died. Yet Pharaoh's heart remained hard, and he refused to let the people go.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses and unto Aaron, Take to you handfuls of ashes of the furnace, and let Moses sprinkle it toward the heaven in the sight of Pharaoh.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses and to Aaron, “Take handfuls of ashes of the furnace, and let Moses sprinkle it toward the sky in the sight of Pharaoh.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses and Aaron, "Take handfuls of soot from a furnace, and have Moses throw it into the air while Pharaoh watches.

verses.kjv: And it shall become small dust in all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boil breaking forth with blains upon man, and upon beast, throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.web: It shall become small dust over all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boils and blisters breaking out on man and on animal, throughout all the land of Egypt.”
verses.ct: It will spread like fine dust across the entire land of Egypt, and wherever it lands, painful boils and blisters will break out on people and animals throughout the country."

verses.kjv: And they took ashes of the furnace, and stood before Pharaoh; and Moses sprinkled it up toward heaven; and it became a boil breaking forth with blains upon man, and upon beast.
verses.web: They took ashes of the furnace, and stood before Pharaoh; and Moses sprinkled it up toward the sky; and it became boils and blisters breaking on man and on animal.
verses.ct: So they took soot from a furnace and stood before Pharaoh. Moses threw it into the air, and painful boils and blisters erupted on people and animals alike.

verses.kjv: And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils; for the boil was upon the magicians, and upon all the Egyptians.
verses.web: The magicians couldn’t stand before Moses because of the boils; for the boils were on the magicians and on all the Egyptians.
verses.ct: Even the magicians were covered in boils and couldn't stand in Moses' presence — they were suffering just like every other Egyptian.

verses.kjv: And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had spoken unto Moses.
verses.web: LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he didn’t listen to them, as LORD had spoken to Moses.
verses.ct: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, and he refused to listen to Moses and Aaron, just as the LORD had told Moses would happen.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and say unto him, Thus saith the LORD God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and tell him, ‘This is what LORD, the God of the Hebrews, says: “Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.ct: Then the LORD said to Moses, "Get up early in the morning, stand before Pharaoh, and tell him, 'This is what the LORD, the God of the Hebrews, says: Let my people go so they can worship me.

verses.kjv: For I will at this time send all my plagues upon thine heart, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people; that thou mayest know that there is none like me in all the earth.
verses.web: For this time I will send all my plagues against your heart, against your officials, and against your people; that you may know that there is no one like me in all the earth.
verses.ct: This time I will unleash the full force of my plagues against you personally, against your officials, and against your people — so you will know that there is no one like me in all the earth.

verses.kjv: For now I will stretch out my hand, that I may smite thee and thy people with pestilence; and thou shalt be cut off from the earth.
verses.web: For now I would have stretched out my hand, and struck you and your people with pestilence, and you would have been cut off from the earth;
verses.ct: I could have already stretched out my hand and struck you and your people with a plague that would have wiped you off the face of the earth.

verses.kjv: And in very deed for this cause have I raised thee up, for to shew in thee my power; and that my name may be declared throughout all the earth.
verses.web: but indeed for this cause I have made you stand: to show you my power, and that my name may be declared throughout all the earth,
verses.ct: But I have kept you alive for this very reason: to demonstrate my power through you, and so that my name will be proclaimed throughout the entire earth.

verses.kjv: As yet exaltest thou thyself against my people, that thou wilt not let them go?
verses.web: because you still exalt yourself against my people, that you won’t let them go.
verses.ct: Yet you still set yourself against my people and refuse to let them go.

verses.kjv: Behold, to morrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail, such as hath not been in Egypt since the foundation thereof even until now.
verses.web: Behold, tomorrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail, such as has not been in Egypt since the day it was founded even until now.
verses.ct: Listen carefully — tomorrow at about this time, I will send the worst hailstorm Egypt has ever seen, from the day it was founded until now.

verses.kjv: Send therefore now, and gather thy cattle, and all that thou hast in the field; for upon every man and beast which shall be found in the field, and shall not be brought home, the hail shall come down upon them, and they shall die.
verses.web: Now therefore command that all of your livestock and all that you have in the field be brought into shelter. The hail will come down on every man and animal that is found in the field, and isn’t brought home, and they will die.” ’ ”
verses.ct: So give the order now: bring your livestock and everything you have in the fields to shelter. Any person or animal left outside when the hail falls will die.'"

verses.kjv: He that feared the word of the LORD among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his cattle flee into the houses:
verses.web: Those who feared LORD’s word among the servants of Pharaoh made their servants and their livestock flee into the houses.
verses.ct: Some of Pharaoh's officials took the LORD's warning seriously and rushed their servants and livestock indoors.

verses.kjv: And he that regarded not the word of the LORD left his servants and his cattle in the field.
verses.web: Whoever didn’t respect LORD’s word left his servants and his livestock in the field.
verses.ct: But those who ignored the LORD's word left their servants and livestock out in the fields.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch forth thine hand toward heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon man, and upon beast, and upon every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand toward the sky, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, on man, and on animal, and on every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.”
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Stretch your hand toward the sky so that hail will fall across all of Egypt — on people, animals, and every plant in the fields."

verses.kjv: And Moses stretched forth his rod toward heaven: and the LORD sent thunder and hail, and the fire ran along upon the ground; and the LORD rained hail upon the land of Egypt.
verses.web: Moses stretched out his rod toward the heavens, and LORD sent thunder and hail; and lightning flashed down to the earth. LORD rained hail on the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: Moses raised his staff toward the heavens, and the LORD sent thunder and hail, with lightning striking the ground. The LORD poured hail down on the land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: So there was hail, and fire mingled with the hail, very grievous, such as there was none like it in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
verses.web: So there was very severe hail, and lightning mixed with the hail, such as had not been in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
verses.ct: The hail was devastating — mixed with lightning flashing through it — worse than anything Egypt had experienced in its entire history as a nation.

verses.kjv: And the hail smote throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both man and beast; and the hail smote every herb of the field, and brake every tree of the field.
verses.web: The hail struck throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both man and animal; and the hail struck every herb of the field, and broke every tree of the field.
verses.ct: Throughout all of Egypt, the hail destroyed everything in the open — people and animals alike. It shredded every plant and shattered every tree in the fields.

verses.kjv: Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, was there no hail.
verses.web: Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, there was no hail.
verses.ct: The only place spared was the land of Goshen, where the Israelites lived. No hail fell there.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh sent, and called for Moses and Aaron, and said unto them, I have sinned this time: the LORD is righteous, and I and my people are wicked.
verses.web: Pharaoh sent and called for Moses and Aaron, and said to them, “I have sinned this time. LORD is righteous, and I and my people are wicked.
verses.ct: Pharaoh urgently summoned Moses and Aaron. "I have sinned this time," he said. "The LORD is in the right, and I and my people are in the wrong.

verses.kjv: Intreat the LORD (for it is enough) that there be no more mighty thunderings and hail; and I will let you go, and ye shall stay no longer.
verses.web: Pray to LORD; for there has been enough of mighty thunderings and hail. I will let you go, and you shall stay no longer.”
verses.ct: Pray to the LORD — we've had enough of this terrible thunder and hail! I'll let you go. You don't have to stay any longer."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto him, As soon as I am gone out of the city, I will spread abroad my hands unto the LORD; and the thunder shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail; that thou mayest know how that the earth is the LORD’s.
verses.web: Moses said to him, “As soon as I have gone out of the city, I will spread out my hands to LORD. The thunders shall cease, and there will not be any more hail; that you may know that the earth is LORD’s.
verses.ct: Moses replied, "As soon as I leave the city, I'll lift my hands in prayer to the LORD. The thunder will stop and the hail will end — so you'll know that the earth belongs to the LORD.

verses.kjv: But as for thee and thy servants, I know that ye will not yet fear the LORD God.
verses.web: But as for you and your servants, I know that you don’t yet fear LORD God.”
verses.ct: But I know that you and your officials still don't truly fear the LORD God."

verses.kjv: And the flax and the barley was smitten: for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was bolled.
verses.web: The flax and the barley were struck, for the barley had ripened and the flax was blooming.
verses.ct: The flax and barley crops were destroyed, since the barley had already formed heads and the flax was in bloom.

verses.kjv: But the wheat and the rie were not smitten: for they were not grown up.
verses.web: But the wheat and the spelt were not struck, for they had not grown up.
verses.ct: But the wheat and spelt survived because they hadn't matured yet.

verses.kjv: And Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh, and spread abroad his hands unto the LORD: and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured upon the earth.
verses.web: Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh, and spread out his hands to LORD; and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured on the earth.
verses.ct: Moses left Pharaoh's presence, went out of the city, and lifted his hands to the LORD. The thunder, hail, and rain stopped immediately.

verses.kjv: And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased, he sinned yet more, and hardened his heart, he and his servants.
verses.web: When Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders had ceased, he sinned yet more, and hardened his heart, he and his servants.
verses.ct: But when Pharaoh saw that the rain, hail, and thunder had stopped, he sinned again. He and his officials hardened their hearts.

verses.kjv: And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, neither would he let the children of Israel go; as the LORD had spoken by Moses.
verses.web: The heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he didn’t let the children of Israel go, just as LORD had spoken through Moses.
verses.ct: Pharaoh's heart was hard, and he refused to let the Israelites go — exactly as the LORD had said through Moses.
